info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 30 at 10:49AM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE LAKE, BOBCAT, DAM, AND RANCH 2 BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Lake, Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Antelope Valley, Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range and Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Lake, Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Lake, Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Southern California residents, in or below the recently burned areas are urged to take the steps necessary to protect their property. Persons in the watch area should remain alert and follow directions of emergency preparedness officials. Local emergency services are monitoring the situation and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
